frameDefinitions: A Hunter tries to gain Food by way of outsmarting or tracking a living.
A Grower endeavors to tend to and influence the environment of Food so as to foster its growth.

A Billing_authority communicates in written form that the Debtor owes the Owed_party (often the same as the Billing_authority) some amount of Money for certain Goods (including services) provided by the Owed_party or to clear a debt for a Bad_action by the Debtor against the Owed_party.
This frame concerns the movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier.
A Gatherer removes Crop ripe and ready to an accepted degree.
An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.
frameExamples: In the Congo, he hunted big game for the first time.
Karl <t>carried</t> the books across campus to the library on his head.
They <t>harvest</t> their pumpkins in the Autumn. INI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Hunter</fen> is the agent hoping to obtain <fen>Food</fen>.
<fen>Food</fen> is the sought-out item by the <fen>Hunter</fen>.
This is the entity to which the <fen>Hunter</fen> pays attention. It is referred to as <fen>Ground</fen> because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Food</fen>.
When the <fen>Time</fen> seeking action occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Hunter</fen> attempts to obtain <fen>Food</fen>.
The <fen>Grower</fen> is the agent growing <fen>Food</fen>.

<fex name='Food'>Food</fex> is the item grown by the <fen>Grower</fen>, which can include things not traditionally eaten, like flowers, etc., or items for other consumption-related uses, like medicines, smokables, etc.
When the growing event occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Grower</fen> grows <fen>Food</fen>.
The person (or organization) that owes the <fen>Owed_party</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction, or as recompense for the <fen>Bad_action</fen>.
In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>.

The <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects a specific amount of <fen>Money</fen> from the <fen>Debtor</fen>, either because the <fen>Debtor</fen> received <fen>Goods</fen> or because the <fen>Debtor</fen> performed a Bad_action against the Owed_party.
The individual who communicates to the <fen>Debtor</fen> the <fen>Money</fen> that they owe.

An earlier action by the <fen>Debtor</fen> causing harm (directly or indirectly) to the <fen>Owed_party</fen>, for which the <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects compensation, and therefore bills the <fen>Debtor</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a sentient being who physically controls the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> via the carrier, accompanying the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the endpoint of the path.
<fen>Source</fen> indicates the beginning of the path along which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
Path along which carrying occurs.
The objects being carried.
<fen>Area</fen> is used for descriprion of a general area in which the carrying action takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Carrier</fen> provides support for the <fen>Theme</fen>.  Movement of the <fen>Carrier</fen> results in movement of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The time in which the carrying event takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that serves as a setting for the specific motion of the <fen>Agent</fen> and <fen>Theme</fen> (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
The <fen>Gatherer</fen> is the agent gathering the <fen>Crop</fen>.
<fen>Crop</fen> is item being collected together by the <fen>Gatherer</fen>.
The <fex name='Source'>Source</fex> is the ground where the <fex name='Crop'>Crop</fex> is gathered from.
When the <fen>Crop</fen> gathering action occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Gatherer</fen> gathers his <fen>Crop</fen>.
The <fen>Ingestor</fen> is the person eating or drinking.
The <fen>Ingestibles</fen> are the entities that are being consumed by the <fen>Ingestor</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: The pizza man billed <fex>Lee</fex> $35 for his order.
The man at the counter billed Lee <fex>for his dry-cleaning</fex>.
The clerk invoiced the little old lady <fex>$49.95</fex> for what she called 'a little hand-holding . '
The cleaner bills <fex>at forty dollars per hour</fex> for his services.
<fex>The salesman</fex> never billed me , so I did n't pay .
<fex>Karl</fex> carried the books across the campus to the library.
Karl carried the books <fex>to the library</fex>.
Karl hauled the books <fex>from the library</fex>  to the office.
Karl carried the books <fex>across the campus</fex>.
Karl toted <fex>the books</fex> to the car.
<fex>The boat</fex> ferried the troops across the river.
<fex>Even in such a small port</fex>, these boats would transport many tons of trade-goods in to shore annually.
<fex>Tubers</fex> harvested immediately after spraying developed gangrene.
They picked the apples <fex>from the tallest trees</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: The Garbage Picking Field Goal Kicking Philadelphia Phenomenon
